availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Gorin (Barren County, Kentucky, merchant and banker)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, banker. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Gorin. Father of Mary E. Gorin, James E. Gorin, Laura Gorin, Emma Gorin, Ellen Gorin and Florence Gorin. Merchant in Barren County, Kentucky in 1850. Banker in Barren County in 1860. Member of the Joint Board of Conference Stewards on the Clerical Committee at the Louisville Conference of the M.E Church, South, in Barren County, in 1863. Owned five enslaved individuals in Barren County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved individuals in Barren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, p. 30.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Jefferson Gorin (Jan 27, 1808-Jan 11, 1883)," Memorial #111825806, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111825806 (accessed April 27, 2020).
"Louisville Conference of the M.E. Church, South,"The Courier-Journal(Louisville, Ky.), October 7, 1863, p. 1.
